style.name: French & Belgian-Style Saison
style.description: Beers in this category are golden to deep amber in color. There may be quite a variety of characters within this style. Generally: They are light to medium in body. Malt aroma is low to medium-low. Esters are medium to high in  aroma, while, complex alcohols, herbs, spices, low Brettanomyces character and even clove and smoke-like phenolics may or may not be evident in the overall balanced beer. Hop aroma and flavor may be at low to medium levels. Malt flavor is low but provides foundation for the overall balance. Hop bitterness is moderate to moderately assertive. Herb and/or spice flavors, including black pepper-like notes, may or may not be evident. Fruitiness from fermentation is generally in character. A balanced small amount of sour or acidic flavors is acceptable when in balance with other components. Earthy, cellar-like, musty aromas are okay. Diacetyl should not be perceived. Chill or slight yeast haze is okay. Often bottle conditioned with some yeast character and high carbonation. French & Belgian-Style Saison may have Brettanomyces characters that are slightly acidity, fruity, horsey, goaty and/or leather-like.

data.name: Saison
data.description: Born from Brad and Gordon’s backyard test batches in Fort Collins, the Saison that sits before you has since evolved into a GABF gold-medal winning beer. This beer is heavily reliant on flavors and aromas generated by our house yeast that showcase our care in every aspect of the brewing process. Our flagship Saison pours with a beautiful orange hue and effervescence. Aromas of passion fruit, tangerine and black pepper first hit the nose before flavors of orange, lemon verbena, clove and pepper lead to a dry and lingering bitterness that awaits another sip.
data.foodPairings: Pairs well with a soft, creamy ripened cows milk cheese.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

data.name: Saison
data.description: Our saison is a pale gold-colored farmhouse-style ale. We use a traditional yeast strain and Continental hops that in combination imbue an aroma with a mild spiciness tempered with fruit. The beer is medium-bodied, with a slight acidity. It is effervescent and dry, with an edge of bitterness that balances the fruitiness of the aroma. A yeast-derived refreshing, spicy ale.

data.name: Saison
data.description: French in origin, saison’s were normally light, quaffable beers brewed with grains on hand to be given to the farm hands in spring and summer during planting and harvest.  Our saison takes that idea and gives it a little twist.  We use pink peppercorns and a mountain of late addition hops to add a spicy, fruity, citrus aroma and flavor.  Add in the four types of malt and the French yeast and you have a beer with intricate flavors and aromas all the way through.  Do some yard work and pretend you are a Belgian-French farmer enjoying the fruits of your labor brought forth in this remarkable, refreshing brew.

data.name: Saison
data.description:
Somewhat effervescent, teased by a light, fruity strain, Saison beers are historically lauded as a refreshing farmhouse beverage handcrafted in cooler seasons and enjoyed by farm workers during warmer months. Many distinctive versions were created.

Today, this flavorful style is gaining popularity bottles at a time, enjoyed in many corners around the globe.

Golden, delicate and earthy, our solid Saison brew boasts a medium body with a crisp, dry finish. Savored here at Bad Water Brewing, our concoction is a soft malt with a low bitterness and citrusy spice. Summery and opaque, it’s perfectly paired with a light fare and a hot, setting sun.

data.name: Saison 484
data.description: Brewed with malts of Haus Malts Pilsner and triticale, a wheat-rye hybrid first bred in laboratories during the late 19th century in Scotland and Germany. Hopped with ADHA-484 hops, which offer an aroma of woody cedar, bubblegum, and spice, and fermented with a traditional farmhouse yeast strain. A nose of lemon and hay and a classic taste that's dry and crisp with a bit of yeasty spice that offers a slightly bitter finish make this an easygoing, well-balanced saison for the summer that you'll return to again and again.

data.name: Saison a la Provision
data.description:
Originally, the farmhouse brewers of Wallonia would produce a weak Saison beer for the workers and a stronger beer to be aged & sometimes blended – destined for the local taverns.

This beer has a primary fermentation with a Saison yeast, then undergoes a secondary fermentation with a blend of Lactobacillus & Brettanomyces. The result is tart, crisp, slightly sour & incredibly refreshing.

available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

data.name: Saison Ale
data.description:
FARMHOUSE INSPIRED
Saisons were originally brewed to keep farmhands happy and hydrated during the warm summer months. True to the style, Yards’ Saison is a semi-unfiltered Belgian style ale brewed with distinctive Belgian yeast. It’s delicate and fruity with a subtle spiciness. Styrian Goldings in the kettle lend a touch of hop to the palate, balancing out this highly drinkable version of the classic style.
data.foodPairings: Break out the grill because Saison is the perfect compliment to anything you throw on the fire. We like pairing it with various types of sausages, a pot of mussels, or Southeastern Asian cuisine.

data.name: Saison Anise
data.description:
Saison Anise is a sustaining drink, strong and full-flavoured. Aged for two months in the bottle, it pours copper gold. Anise has a complex grain bill; using Canterbury pilsner malt and crystal malts from Gladfields.

Floral hop varieties, harmonise with candi sugar and certain spices, producing an elusive and enticing aroma. Our saison yeast envelops all into a drink that will beg another.

data.name: Saison Ardennes
data.description: Saison Ardennes is a tart saison, hand-crafted to embody the dependable, spirited nature of a classic Belgian-style farmhouse ale. This includes a crisp malt profile, rustic floral and spice notes and lively carbonation. Our rendition expresses further depth and character from its fermentation and maturation in a large oak foeder. Saison Ardennes will continue to pleasantly evolve in the bottle, thanks to the presence of wild yeast added for bottle conditioning.

data.name: Saison au Miel
data.description: Seasonal, farmhouse-style ales that feature native Colorado ingredients. Dry and crisp farmhouse-style ale. Mild tartness softened by Colorado wildflower honey.

data.description: Dry and crisp farmhouse-style ale. Mild tartness with bitter Colorado chokecherries.

data.name: Saison Bernice
data.description: Saison Bernice is an exquisitely fermented farmhouse ale. Dry and refreshing, Bernice is made of the freshest on-hand and locally available ingredients. She receives multiple yeast additions, including Brettanomyces, and is further aged in the bottle.

data.name: Saison Blanche
data.description: Saison Blanche is an ode to the hot summer season and to those who labor tirelessly towards an abundant harvest. With a peppery spiciness and a silky rich mouthfeel imparted by the yeast, this aromatic, golden farmhouse ale serves to refresh you on those long summer days.

data.name: Saison Bleu
data.description: Belgium meets So Cal with our latest Saison. Brewed with ginger and locally grown California native Blue Sage, Salvia clevelandii. This beer will give you a new perspective on an old style.

data.name: Saison D'Avon
data.description: Pilsner malt, flaked wheat and oats form the base of this beer. Hopping with Brewers Gold, Savinjski Goldings, and Chinook compliment the Grains of Paradise added late in the boil. A cool fermentation lets all of the ingredients shine – the result: a soft, fruity, fluffy and delicious rendition of a Saison.

data.name: Saison d'Etre
data.description: This is a spicy straw-colored beer with a slight haze. It starts out fruity but has a peppery dry finish. It is spiced with coriander, bitter orange, black pepper and juniper berries. Very refreshing.

data.name: Saison de Aviator
data.description: This style is a Belgian wheat beer spiced with coriander and sweet orange peel.  An unfiltered golden colored ale with a fruity trappist yeast.  A crowd pleaser.  Great beer to pick up your spirits after mowing the lawn.  Or to get your head working better after a days work in the old cube farm.

data.name: Saison de Banc Noir
data.description: By combining the rustic, peppery flavors of our farmhouse yeast strain with the complex dark fruit notes of roasted wheat and dark Belgian candi syrups, we’ve created an intricately delicate “Black Saison” that contains ornate notes of raisins, dark grape, and peppercorns.

data.name: Saison De Beaver
data.description:
This summer seasonal will be available from June through September.

Saison translates to “Season” in English.  Farmers across Europe would make Farmhouse Ales for the summer months for a few reasons…

Most importantly it was a “big” beer.  They added “extreme” amounts of hops and malt to have a beer that wouldn’t spoil in the hot summer months.  The hops were usually very low in Alpha Acid content so the beer was not overly bitter.  It was considered a strong beer for the time even though it topped out at 4% ABV.

Malts: Pilsner, Wheat, and White Wheat
Hops: Nobel Hops – Tettnang & Hallertau

data.name: Saison De Liason
data.description: This Hoppy Saison is single hopped with Blanc. This is Virginia Spring in a beer. The floral notes are those of a spring perennial garden- (not tropical)

data.name: Saison De Lis
data.description: A straw colored Belgian-style Saison brewed with chamomile flowers. It is fermented with a traditional saison yeast strain that imparts fruity and spicy notes that dovetail perfectly with the tea-like quality of the chamomile. Finishes dry, tart, and refreshing.

data.name: Saison De Pom
data.description: The visit of the Arizona Wilderness friends was the source of inspiration for a collaboration between worlds, as well as between breweries. A little bit cider beer, the Saison de Pom is the one that could be enjoyed in an imaginary farmhouse with an annexed apple orchard ... rustic and fruity, dry and drinkable, a saison with a unique character.

data.name: Saison de Ruisseau
data.description: We curse daily at this beer because it takes so long to ferment, but it's worth the wait, despite our emotional scarring.  This Belgian-style Saison has golden/light copper color, light body, medium hop bitterness, flavor & aroma, medium-low malt flavor & aroma and spiciness from added coriander.  Fruity esters dominate the aroma while complex alcohols, acidity, low Brettanomyces character and clove and smoke-like phenolics from Saison yeast.

available.name: Limited
available.description: Limited availability.

data.name: Saison De Silas
data.description: Richly reward yourself with Silas, a farmhouse ale with good moral character and light hearted attitude. Silas is designed for all occasions and will most definitely put a smile on your face after the first sip. A New Zealand hop focus, European malt character and brewers’ tears (of the happy kind) aid your journey into this smooth, joyful and crisp ale designed for all beer lovers. Continue that positive attitude or cheer up with Scarlet Lane Brewing Company’s Saison de SILAS

data.name: Saison de Walt
data.description: A complex Belgian farmhouse ale brewed in honor of a lost beer legend, Walt Powell. After fermentation, the Saison de Walt is blended with a beer that has been aging in wine barrels with the wild yeast Brettanomyces, further adding to the uniqueness of this very dry and complex ale

style.name: Belgian-Style Pale Ale
style.description: Belgian-style pale ales are characterized by low but noticeable hop bitterness, flavor, and aroma. Light to medium body and low malt aroma are typical. They are light amber to deep amber in color. Noble-type hops are commonly used. Low to medium fruity esters are evident in aroma and flavor. Low levels of phenolic spiciness from yeast byproducts may be perceived. Low caramel or toasted malt flavor is okay. Diacetyl should not be perceived. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.

data.name: Saison de Waterloo
data.description: The story of the Saison begins in Belgium’s Wallonian province, within which the municipality of Waterloo resides. We take pride in continuing the tale stateside, in Waterloo, IA. This carefully crafted chapter is home to no battle, as the rustic malt bill, bright hops and spicy Belgian yeast strain peacefully collaborate, scripting an intriguing, American influenced, farmhouse ale.

data.name: Saison De ‘Ron
data.description: Historically a beer to repay farmhands, this is a style that places emphasis on the yeast most predominantly. A spiced flavor flirts with grassy and floral hops lending depth and intrigue. It’s pale straw color of continental malts brings you back to the Belgian grain fields in which this style was conceived. The crisp, dry finish tumbles off the palate and pairs well with herb crusted chicken and wild mushrooms.

data.name: Saison des Fetes - Guava
data.description: This effervescent brew goes down easy in the summer heat. An ideal blend of rare Southern Star hops and pink guava. Each sip offers a dizzying array of guava and pineapple notes. A slight citrus tartness cleans up the aftertaste and leaves you wanting more.

data.name: Saison des fetes - Nelson Sauvin
data.description: Our interpretation of this classical Belgian seasonal bridges old world techniques with new world innovation. The expression aroma of the unique yeast strain, the subtle balance and crisp mineral finish has been married with one of the most sought after hops in the world. Grown exclusively in New Zealand, Nelson Sauvin is renowned for its flavor of Viognier and muscat grapes. This is our most elegant and refined saison offering yet.

data.name: Saison Diego
data.description: Unfiltered golden farmhouse ale, brewed with Seville orange peels, Chinese ginger and grains of paradise. Light, bright, spicy aromas, lively carbonation and earthy flavors co-mingle with musty notes that add funky complexity.

style.description: Beers in this category are golden to deep amber in color. There may be quite a variety of characters within this style. Generally: They are light to medium in body. Malt aroma is low to medium-low. Esters are medium to high in  aroma, while, complex alcohols, herbs, spices, low Brettanomyces character and even clove and smoke-like phenolics may or may not be evident in the overall balanced beer. Hop aroma and flavor may be at low to medium levels. Malt flavor is low but provides foundation for the overall balance. Hop bitterness is moderate to moderately assertive. Herb and/or spice flavors, including black pepper-like notes, may or may not be evident. Fruitiness from fermentation is generally in character. A balanced small amount of sour or acidic flavors is acceptable when in balance with other components. Earthy, cellar-like, musty aromas are okay. Diacetyl should not be perceived. Chill or slight yeast haze is okay. Often bottle conditioned with some yeast character and high carbonation. French & Belgian-Style Saison may have Brettanomyces characters that are slightly acidity, fruity, horsey, goaty and/or leather-like.

data.name: Saison Dolores
data.description: Introducing Saison Dolores, Almanac’s newest year-round beer. A bright, aromatic brew for all seasons inspired by San Francisco’s Mission District. We combine barley, rye and Sonoran Wheat grown in Mendocino County and ferment the beer with our house Saison yeast. Finally we dry hop it to create a California Saison with flavors of spicy white pepper, fruity melon and a clean food friendly finish.
data.foodPairings: Enjoy this lively aromatic farmhouse ale with fresh seafood, funky washed rind cheeses and classic french-style charcuterie.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: French & Belgian-Style Saison
style.description: Beers in this category are golden to deep amber in color. There may be quite a variety of characters within this style. Generally: They are light to medium in body. Malt aroma is low to medium-low. Esters are medium to high in  aroma, while, complex alcohols, herbs, spices, low Brettanomyces character and even clove and smoke-like phenolics may or may not be evident in the overall balanced beer. French & Belgian-Style Saison may have Brettanomyces characters that are slightly acidity, fruity, horsey, goaty and/or leather-like.

data.name: Saison du BUFF
data.description:
The idea for this beer germinated way back in 2003 when the three guys (Sam from Dogfish, Greg from Stone and Bill from Victory) formed the BUFF alliance (Brewers United for Freedom of Flavor) - a noble endeavor with the goal to highlight the passion and camaraderie of the American craft brew movement.

So, BUFF didn't really do anything (beyond talk a lot of talk) until 2010 when the three brewers finally got together to jointly brew at beer at the Stone Brewery. Saison du BUFF was first brewed at Stone and then replicated at each of the other two breweries - same recipe, same ingredients, three different breweries

available.name: Limited
available.description: Limited availability.

style.name: French & Belgian-Style Saison
style.description: Beers in this category are golden to deep amber in color. There may be quite a variety of characters within this style. Generally: They are light to medium in body. Malt aroma is low to medium-low. Esters are medium to high in  aroma, while, complex alcohols, herbs, spices, low Brettanomyces character and even clove and smoke-like phenolics may or may not be evident in the overall balanced beer. Hop aroma and flavor may be at low to medium levels. Malt flavor is low but provides foundation for the overall balance. Hop bitterness is moderate to moderately assertive. Herb and/or spice flavors, including black pepper-like notes, may or may not be evident. Fruitiness from fermentation is generally in character. A balanced small amount of sour or acidic flavors is acceptable when in balance with other components. Earthy, cellar-like, musty aromas are okay. Diacetyl should not be perceived. Chill or slight yeast haze is okay. Often bottle conditioned with some yeast character and high carbonation. French & Belgian-Style Saison may have Brettanomyces characters that are slightly acidity, fruity, horsey, goaty and/or leather-like.

data.name: Saison du Buff
data.description:
This beer is collaboration between Dogfish Head, Stone Brewing Co. (Escondido, CA) and Victory Brewing Company (Downingtown, PA).
The idea for this beer germinated way back in 2003 when the three guys (Sam from Dogfish, Greg from Stone and Bill from Victory) formed the BUFF alliance (Brewers United for Freedom of Flavor) - a noble endeavor with the goal to highlight the passion and camaraderie of the American craft brew movement.
So, BUFF didn't really do anything (beyond talk a lot of talk) until 2010 when the three brewers finally got together to jointly brew at beer at the Stone Brewery. Saison du BUFF was first brewed at Stone and then replicated at each of the other two breweries - same recipe, same ingredients, three different breweries throughout 2010. 

Saison du BUFF is a Saison brewed with parsley, sage, rosemary and thyme. The beer is brewed three times, once at each brewery using the same recipe.
